rqm-postulate-1-limited-information.rela.statement: there is a maximum amount of relevant information that can be extracted from a system.

rqm-postulate-2-unlimited-information.re.statement: it is always possible to acquire new information about a system.

rqm-postulate-3-superposition.relational.statement: if c and b define two complete families of questions, then the unitary matrix u_cb in p(q^(i)_c, q^(j)_b) = |u^(ij)_cb|² can be chosen in such a way that for every c, b and d, we have u_cd = u_cb u_bd and the effect of composite questions is given by eq.(17).

rqm-hypothesis-1-all-systems-equivalent..statement: all systems are equivalent: nothing distinguishes a priori macroscopic systems from quantum systems. if the observer o can give a quantum description of the system s, then it is also legitimate for an observer p to give a quantum description of the system formed by the observer o.
rqm-hypothesis-1-all-systems-equivalent..rationale: this hypothesis rejects any fundamental distinction between system/observer, quantum/classical system, or physical system/consciousness. it allows any physical system to serve as an observer.

rqm-hypothesis-2-completeness.relational.statement: quantum mechanics provides a complete and self-consistent scheme of description of the physical world, appropriate to our present level of experimental observations.
rqm-hypothesis-2-completeness.relational.rationale: this hypothesis asserts that quantum mechanics is complete and does not require hidden variables or additional underlying theories.

rqm-claim-2-observer-dependence.relation.statement: in quantum mechanics, different observers may give different accounts of the same sequence of events. quantum mechanical descriptions are relative to a particular observer.

rqm-claim-3-information-theory.relationa.statement: quantum mechanics is a theory about the physical description of physical systems relative to other systems, and this is a complete description of the world. physics is the theory of the relative information that systems have about each other.

rqm-claim-4-no-absolute-state.relational.statement: the notion of observer-independent state of a system, or observer-independent values of physical quantities, is inadequate to describe the physical world beyond the ħ → 0 limit. there is no absolute state of a system, only states relative to other systems.

rqm-claim-5-planck-constant.relational-q.statement: postulate 1 (limited information) already adds planck's constant to classical physics. planck's constant can be viewed as the transformation coefficient between physical units (position × momentum) and information-theoretical units (bits).

rqm-claim-6-formalism-reconstruction.rel.statement: the full formalism of quantum mechanics can be (almost) reconstructed from postulates 1 and 2. the physical content of the general formalism of quantum mechanics is (almost) nothing but a sequence of consequences of two physical facts expressed in postulates 1 and 2.

rqm-claim-7-relational-values.relational.statement: in quantum mechanics, 'state' as well as 'value of a variable' or 'outcome of a measurement' are relational notions in the same sense in which velocity is relational in classical mechanics. all physical variables are relational.

rqm-claim-8-measurement-problem.relation.statement: the measurement problem (the unease with quantum mechanics) derives from the use of an incorrect notion: the notion of observer-independent state of a system, or observer-independent values of physical quantities. by abandoning such a notion, quantum mechanics makes much more sense.

workflow_strengths: Strength: All entities created successfully on first attempt with no validation failures | What Enabled This: The required_fields were clear from the model schema, and I checked existing entities before creating new ones | How to Replicate: Maintain clear required_fields in model schema and encourage checking existing entities before creation

ai_feedback.session_summary: Successfully analyzed Rovelli 1996 paper on Relational Quantum Mechanics and updated the models with 3 postulates, 2 assumptions (hypotheses), and 6 claims. The paper, person (Carlo Rovelli), and theory already existed, so I focused on enriching the theory with detailed postulates and claims extracted from the paper.
ai_feedback.entities_created_summary: Created 11 entities: 3 postulates (Limited information, Unlimited information, Superposition principle), 2 assumptions (All systems equivalent, Completeness), and 6 claims covering observer-dependence, information theory interpretation, absence of absolute states, Planck constant as information unit, formalism reconstruction, relational values, and measurement problem resolution.
what_worked_well: The model schema clearly showed required_fields, making entity creation straightforward
Checking existing entities before creation prevented duplicates
The paper was well-structured making extraction of postulates and claims straightforward
ai_feedback.model_insights: The model structure effectively supports physics paper analysis. The separation of postulates, assumptions, and claims allows for clear categorization of different types of theoretical statements.
